member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.Handshake
member.summary: Specifies the control protocol used in establishing a serial port communication for a object.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.Handshake.None
member.summary: No control is used for the handshake.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.Handshake.RequestToSend
member.summary: Request-to-Send (RTS) hardware flow control is used. RTS signals that data is available for transmission. If the input buffer becomes full, the RTS line will be set to . The RTS line will be set to when more room becomes available in the input buffer.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.Handshake.RequestToSendXOnXOff
member.summary: Both the Request-to-Send (RTS) hardware control and the XON/XOFF software controls are used.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.Handshake.XOnXOff
member.summary: The XON/XOFF software control protocol is used. The XOFF control is sent to stop the transmission of data. The XON control is sent to resume the transmission. These software controls are used instead of Request to Send (RTS) and Clear to Send (CTS) hardware controls.

member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.Parity
member.summary: Specifies the parity bit for a object.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.Parity.Even
member.summary: Sets the parity bit so that the count of bits set is an even number.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.Parity.Mark
member.summary: Leaves the parity bit set to 1.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.Parity.None
member.summary: No parity check occurs.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.Parity.Odd
member.summary: Sets the parity bit so that the count of bits set is an odd number.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.Parity.Space
member.summary: Leaves the parity bit set to 0.

member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.SerialData
member.summary: Specifies the type of character that was received on the serial port of the object.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialData.Chars
member.summary: A character was received and placed in the input buffer.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialData.Eof
member.summary: The end of file character was received and placed in the input buffer.

member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.SerialDataReceivedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event.

member.name: P:System.IO.Ports.SerialDataReceivedEventArgs.EventType
member.summary: Gets or sets the event type.
member.returns: One of the values.

member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.SerialDataReceivedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a object.
member.param: The sender of the event, which is the object.
A object that contains the event data.

member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.SerialError
member.summary: Specifies errors that occur on the object.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialError.Frame
member.summary: The hardware detected a framing error.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialError.Overrun
member.summary: A character-buffer overrun has occurred. The next character is lost.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialError.RXOver
member.summary: An input buffer overflow has occurred. There is either no room in the input buffer, or a character was received after the end-of-file (EOF) character.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialError.RXParity
member.summary: The hardware detected a parity error.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialError.TXFull
member.summary: The application tried to transmit a character, but the output buffer was full.

member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.SerialErrorReceivedEventArgs
member.summary: Prepares data for the event.

member.name: P:System.IO.Ports.SerialErrorReceivedEventArgs.EventType
member.summary: Gets or sets the event type.
member.returns: One of the values.

member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.SerialErrorReceivedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a object.
member.param: The sender of the event, which is the object.
A object that contains the event data.

member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.SerialPinChange
member.summary: Specifies the type of change that occurred on the object.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialPinChange.Break
member.summary: A break was detected on input.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialPinChange.CDChanged
member.summary: The Carrier Detect (CD) signal changed state. This signal is used to indicate whether a modem is connected to a working phone line and a data carrier signal is detected.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialPinChange.CtsChanged
member.summary: The Clear to Send (CTS) signal changed state. This signal is used to indicate whether data can be sent over the serial port.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialPinChange.DsrChanged
member.summary: The Data Set Ready (DSR) signal changed state. This signal is used to indicate whether the device on the serial port is ready to operate.

member.name: F:System.IO.Ports.SerialPinChange.Ring
member.summary: A ring indicator was detected.

member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.SerialPinChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event.

member.name: P:System.IO.Ports.SerialPinChangedEventArgs.EventType
member.summary: Gets or sets the event type.
member.returns: One of the values.

member.name: T:System.IO.Ports.SerialPinChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a object.
member.param: The source of the event, which is the object.
A object that contains the event data.
